ETYMOLOGY: From Anglo-Norman sudein, Old French sodain, ultimately from Latin subitus ('sudden, unexpected'), past participle of subire ('to approach, to come up stealthily').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Happening quickly and without warning; unexpected.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There was a sudden downpour, forcing everyone to run for cover.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 突然下起了倾盆大雨，迫使每个人都跑去躲雨。
